subject  friday brown bag lunch on option pricing zimin  i have talked to alex about it  i don  t think that the additional seminar will crowd out the brown bag lunch  the seminar are really targeted to people who recently joined the group and have very limited  or zero  exposure to energy market  for most member of the group it should be the piece of cake  brown bag lunch are not that time intensive  except for the speaker  plus  we ran out of day available for lunch meeting  vince                       forwarded by vince j kaminski  hou  ect on         am                            alex huang  enron         pm to  vince j kaminski  hou  ect  ect cc  stinson gibner  hou  ect  ect subject  friday brown bag lunch on option pricing vince  this is a brief summary of last year  s friday brown bag lunch option pricing series  we had about  lecture  given by the following people  grant  stinston  vasant  krishna  zimin  maureen  clayton  paulo  chonawee  myself  and some outside speaker  we were able to attract some outside audience a well  overall the response is quite encouraging and we have planned to continue it  in light of the presently scheduled seminar on  energy derivative   it seems our friday schedule will be too crowded if we have seminar on  energy derivative  on two friday and fbblop on other friday  what  s your suggestion  should we discontinue the fbblop  we also have scheduled january  for tom halliburton  s visitor leon lasdon from ut austin to talk on non  linear programming  should we cancel it  best  zimin  alex

subject  california update       a source within the generator community confirms press reporting that coram energy plan to file an involuntary bankruptcy early next week  through an intermediary  we were able to corroborate this information with a senior member of the ca iso board  coram energy is a relatively small wind generator qf based in west vancouver  british columbia  though it also owns wind station in california  coram ha   kw unit   the source belief that this filing may have been precipitated by the fact that many people believe it would take a blackout for governor davis to be able to get his bailout plan passed by the legislature  it is unlikely that blackout would happen in april or may  meaning a long wait for the cash strapped qfs to wait to get paid   the filing will be against socal   in order to file an involuntary bankruptcy  coram would have to file along with at least two other creditor owed     or more  source report coram ha two other creditor who will file with them  working on finding out who they are    source also report that other qfs are  taking legal advice  on how to proceed in light of these development

subject  re  informs abstract  fwd            forwarded message           date  sun   oct          edt  from  shijie deng to  vkaminski  aol  com cc  shijie deng subject  re  informs abstract vince  thanks for the abstract  for the purpose of the conference program listing  the conference organizer need a title and an abstract which is longer than  word  based on the abstract that you sent me  i took the liberty to make up a title and the   word abstract  attached below   please make change a you feel necessary and send them back to me  i  ll send them out to the organizer once i get your confirmation on this  best  shijie title  current challenge in modeling power price volatility author  dr  vince kaminski  head of quantitative research  enron capital  trade resource abstract  the power market development in the u have created several unique challenge for energy industry economist  we discus the major factor underlying the exceptionally high volatility of electricity price  we feel that some of them may be a necessary price to pay for increased market efficiency and expanded customer choice  shi  jie deng assistant professor school of isye georgia institute of technology office phone        e  mail  deng  isye  gatech  edu home page  http    www  isye  gatech  edu   deng on sun   oct  vkaminski  aol  com wrote   shijie    i am sending you the abstract for my informs presentation    vince            the last three year were characterized by exceptionally high volatility of  the power price in the u market  the market development have created a  number of unique challenge for energy industry economist  one immediate  question we have to answer is how to measure volatility of energy price   although we can all agree that the price in the power market are  characterized by high variability  the traditional measure used in financial  economics  annualized standard deviation of log price return  may not fit  well electricity price  the second challenge is to explain the source of  high price volatility and to answer the question to what extent it can be  attributed to problem that can be addressed in the long run  such problem  include flaw in market design that allow some market participant to abuse  market power  limited availability and  or unequal access to transmission   temporary shortage of generation capacity  some factor underlying high  volatility of electricity price may be of permanent nature and may be a  necessary price to pay for increased market efficiency and expanded customer  choice

subject  re  choosing the riskfree rate dear all  i completeley agree with ben that treasury are the most liquid and reliable benchmark  i also think that fmas have their own advantage and disadvantage  however  it look like it would be very difficult for u to avoid using libor a benchmark  at least to price anything related to capital market  for example  credit default swap   our price will always be different from that on capital market if we use benchmark different from the market  a a half  way solution we can have different benchmark  for example  use anything  that we decide is closest to risk  free  to value product significantly different from that priced on capital market  and libor for everything priced on capital market  we can adjust by manipulating other coefficient  event  liquidity  recovery  for our purpose  but it look like benchmark should be libor  to avoid negative default probabilites  for highly rated reference entity  we can add cost fo repo and haircut  a all banker do   let u continue our discussion on this  slava benjamin parson         to  bryan seyfried  lon  ect  ect  martin mcdermott  lon  ect  ect  viacheslav danilov  lon  ect  ect  stuart ffoulkes  lon  ect  ect  eklavya sareen  lon  ect  ect  tomas valnek  lon  ect  ect  john metzler  lon  ect  ect  simon brook  lon  ect  ect  konstantin malinovski  lon  ect  ect cc  vasant shanbhogue  hou  ect  ect  vince j kaminski  hou  ect  ect  steven leppard  lon  ect  ect  jitendra patel  lon  ect  ect  william s bradford  hou  ect  ect  harry arora  hou  ect  ect subject  choosing the riskfree rate dear all  following on from the discussion had with vince et al a few week ago  regarding the problem inherent in using treasury a our benchmark riskfree curve  i  ve written the attached short document  my preliminary conclusion are a follows  recent turmoil in the treasury market mostly hit  and   year bond  treasury are still the most liquid curve  and that used by bank for benchmarking risky debt  there is a considerable a liquidity  scarcity premium inherent within the corporate  treasury spread  which we are not taking into account  more accurate measurement of this premium should allow u to calculate bankruptcy price based on treasury  which are consistent with the market  all further comment are welcome of course  regard ben

 sa  the  window for an interactive session with sa should open on your desktop  you are in business    you also need to install your ftp  follow the procedure with the software  and then create a new subject  nytimes  com article  the real wolf this article from nytimes  com ha been sent to you by vkaminski  aol  com                       advertisement                         looking for better it solution  toshiba is uniting digital  mobile and network innovation in a bold new vision of information technology for today and tomorrow  take a closer look at life in the new digital age  and imagine how good it can be  visit toshiba  com for more detail  the real wolf reckoning by paul krugman ecently i received a letter from an economist i respect  chiding me for my  naderite  column on the california energy crisis  he just didn  t believe that market manipulation by power company could possibly be an important issue  it sounded too much to him like the sort of thing one hears from knee  jerk leftist  who blame greedy capitalist for every problem  be it third  world poverty or high apartment rent  the left ha cried  wolf   so many time that sensible people have learned to discount such claim  but now a bona fide wolf ha arrived  whose predatory behavior is doing terrible damage to our most populous state   and nobody will believe it  true  california would be heading for a summer of power shortage even if it had never deregulated  and even if there wa workable competition in the wholesale electricity market  price in that market would spike during period of peak demand  transferring billion of dollar from either taxpayer or consumer to the generator  but the evidence is now overwhelming that there isn  t workable competition in california  s power market  and that the action of generator  gaming the system  have greatly magnified the crisis  the key fact is that california ha somehow remained in a state of more or le continuous power shortage and very high wholesale price regardless of the level of demand  a rash of outage ha kept the electricity market conveniently   and very profitably   short of supply even during period of low demand  when there ought to be lot of excess capacity  a frank wolak  the stanford economist who also advises the state  s power grid  ha pointed out  an outage at a power plant is a lot like an employee calling in sick  you can  t tell directly whether he is really sick or ha chosen to take the day off for other reason  but you can look for circumstantial evidence  and such evidence ha convinced mr  wolak that  generator use forced outage strategically to withhold capacity from the market    a view shared by a growing number of other researcher  which brings u to the latest move by the federal energy regulatory commission  on wednesday  the commission apparently decided to offer california some relief  and put new price cap in place on the california electricity market  i say  apparently  because the more you look at the plan the le likely it seems to be any help at all  indeed  the measure wa passed on a   to   vote  with william massey   the one commissioner who ha been sympathetic to call for price control   voting against it on the ground that it would be ineffectual  what  s wrong with ferc  s plan  first  it cap price only in emergency condition   ignoring the fact that electricity price have stayed at hard  to  explain level even when there is no emergency  in effect  the plan is laid out a if the electricity market were really competitive  in spite of all the evidence that it is not  second  even those emergency price cap are full of loophole  offering extensive opportunity for what mr  wolak call  megawatt laundering    selling power to affiliated company that for one reason or another are exempted from the price control  for example  the control do not apply to  import  from neighboring state   then selling it back into the california market  severin borenstein of the university of california energy institute add that because the allowed price depends on the cost of generation at the least efficient plant  generator will have a clear incentive to produce inefficiently   i predict we will find some plant we never heard of before that are suddenly operating again  and they will be pretty inefficient   the general verdict seems to be that this is not a serious plan  there are serious proposal to mitigate the crisis out there   indeed  last fall mr  wolak submitted a proposal that wa well received by other expert   but ferc ha ignored all of them  the charitable interpretation is that ferc still doesn  t get it  that it just can  t bring itself to believe that this time the wolf is real  the uncharitable interpretation is that last week  s action wa meant to fail  the medley report  an online newsletter  call the ferc plan  a grand exercise in posturing without substance    a very clever temporary move by the bush administration to deflect any political fallout  from the looming disaster  whatever the explanation  the plain fact is that ferc and the administration have yet to offer california any significant relief   fo  b  blabf visit nytimes  com for complete access to the most authoritative news coverage on the web  updated throughout the day  become a member today  it  s free  http    www  nytimes  com  eta how to at alyson  nytimes  com or visit our online medium kit at http    www  nytimes  com  adinfo for general information about nytimes  com  write to help  nytimes  com  copyright  the new york time valery kholodnyi  on           pm to  vkamins  enron  com cc  subject  my model for spike dear dr  kaminski  i wa recently allowed to release into the public domain on the limited basis the first of the preprints that i recently authored on my model for spike in power price and for the valuation of the contingent claim on power  in this regard  i have just given a talk on this model at the joint seminar of the center for energy finance education and research and the institute for computational finance at the ut austin  right now i am also in the process of forming a list of specialist both in the industry and academia who might be interested in receiving this preprint  please let me know if you might be interested in receiving this preprint  i look forward to hearing from you  sincerely yours  valery kholodnyi manager of quantitative analysis research and analytics group txu energy trading p  here are the main preprints that i have recently authored on my model for spike in power price and valuation of contingent claim on power    valery a  kholodnyi  the stochastic process for power price with spike and valuation of european contingent claim on power  preprint  txu  rag      july     valery a  khlolodnyi  valuation of a swing option on power with spike  preprint txu  rag      august      valery a  kholodnyi  valuation of a spark spread option on power with spike  preprint txu  rag      november     valery a  kholodnyi  valuation of european contingent claim on power at two distinct point on the grid with spike in both power price  preprint txu  rag      november     valery a  kholodnyi  valuation of a transmission option on power with spike  preprint txu  rag      november   a i have indicated to you in my previous e  mail  contrary to the standard approach  i model spike directly  a self  reversing jump on top of a stochastic process for the regular dynamic of power price in the absence of spike  in this way the dynamic of power price is modeled a a non  markovian process  even if the process for the regular dynamic of power price is markovian  among other thing my model for spike allows for the explicit valuation and hedging of contingent claim on power with spike  provided that the corresponding contingent claim on power can be valued and hedged in the absence of spike

subject   chairman  s award everyday hero are all around u at enron  living our core value of respect  integrity  communication and excellence in everything they do  some of these hero make a big splash while others just quietly make a difference in the workplace around them  either way  these special individual deserve to be recognized with a nomination for the  chairman  s award  a there is more than just one employee living the value at enron  this award program will honor  employee a member of the chairman  s roundtable  from that group  the one individual most embodying our value will be presented with the chairman  s award at the management conference in san antonio in november  the beauty of this award program is that it is completely employee  driven from beginning to end  from your nomination  an international employee committee will select the chairman  s roundtable and eventually  the chairman  s award winner  your role of nominating our everyday hero is extremely vital to the program  s success  if someone ha made a positive impression on you  please take the time to complete a nomination form and send it to charla reese by october     you may click here for a printable form  http    home  enron  com  announce  chairman _ nom  form   doc for more information on the chairman  s award  including detail on last year  s roundtable member and previous winner  repit suliyono and bobbye brown  please click here  http    home  enron  com  announce  chairman _ nom again  this is a very special award at enron and we sincerely thank you for your participation  ken  jeff and joe

subject  re  var calibration issue we are proposing the following change to the calculation of ng correlation    weight the data set   calendar month  used in calculating correlation  most recent data weighed heavier    use respective contract price  instead of prompt month price  i  e  for nov   correlation use nov contract price for the last  month  a opposed to prompt month price for the last three month  tanya  i have confirmed with ted and he gave u green light to make both change  did we get an opinion from vince  winston  it is my understanding  that this change apply to ng correlation only  not the correlation between commodity  we will test the change in gas and then decide on world  wide implementation  any estimate on timing of this implementation  cassandra  ted suggested that you and veronica should document this a a change in var parameter and inform all commercial desk head of these change  we intend to make them for na gas first  but ultimately make these change consistent across all commodity group  let me know if you have question  thanks  vlady  wenyao jia         pm to  vladimir gorny  hou  ect  ect cc  tanya tamarchenko  hou  ect  ect  jin yu  hou  ect  ect subject  re  var calibration issue vlady  also in the meeting  we identified that there are still some issures regarding to the correlation matrix calculation  since different commodity ha different expiration date  when calculate correlation between two commodity  the two may have different prompt month  are we going to use price on two different prompt month or are we going to use the price on the same month disregarding prompt month  because above issue  jin is not going do any change on the correlation matrix calculation until above issures can be solved  thanks  winston tanya tamarchenko         pm to  vladimir gorny  hou  ect  ect cc  wenyao jia  hou  ect  ect  jin yu  hou  ect  ect  jin yu  hou  ect  ect subject  re  var calibration issue vlady  we met with winston and jin today regarding var calibration issue  the outcome on this discussion is    jin will put weight into calculation of factor loading    jin will change the way factor loading are calculated  for each commodity the prompt month contract will be selected for the effective date of vatrfacs run  then the historical price will be collected for  month for all forward contract starting from selected prompt month contract  the variance  covariance matrix will be calculated based on these data  it will be converted into correlation matrix  then factor loading analysis will be performed on the correlation matrix  tanya

subject  computerworld article fyi  several error like  brokering  in the report but given the fact that the guy had no clue what enron doe or company like it do  this came out okay  in all of the pr group  s marketing effort  enron a a market  maker is the message  ravi       forwarded by ravi thuraisingham  enron communication on         am      shelly mansfield         am to  ravi thuraisingham  enron communication  enron communication cc  subject  computerworld article shelly mansfield enron broadband service      office      fax      pager      cellular      forwarded by shelly mansfield  enron communication on         am      norman levine         am to  shelly mansfield  enron communication  enron communication cc  subject  computerworld article following is the computerworld article  link  enron seek to broker storage deal between user  ssps by lucas mearian while technology service provider have long been talking about data storage a a utility that should be sold in the open marketplace like electricity or natural gas  little ha been done to pool market resource in order to hawk surplus disk  array capacity  but that  s exactly what a subsidiary of houston  based energy and communication conglomerate enron corp  is doing by launching a business  to  business exchange that it said will seek to match spare capacity owned by storage service provider  ssp  with corporate user who want to be able to quickly scale up and down the amount of storage they have available  enron broadband service this week announced that it ha already signed a deal with waltham  mass   based storagenetworks inc  and is negotiating similar agreement with at least six other ssps  if successful  analyst said  enron  s business proposition could go far toward generating a set of operating standard for the emerging ssp business   it  s a market with mix of small and large player and company that define their role differently   said ken weilerstein  an analyst at gartner group inc  in stamford  conn  enron  s plan also could help enterprise  level user get additional benefit along with the storage capacity they  re renting  such a security and disaster recovery support  he added  ravi thuraisingham  director of global bandwidth risk management at enron broadband service  said the new offering won  t include additional security feature  but enron doe plan to standardize on a set of ssp service and bundle them with disaster recovery and communication bandwidth capability  he said  initially  enron   which had total revenue of   billion last year   expects to charge user monthly fee of   to   per gigabyte of managed storage  depending on market condition and the length of time a company expects to need the capacity   we  re there to try to discover a market clearing price   said thuraisingham  adding that the service is tentatively due to go online in the third quarter  enron said it ha already signed best buy co   one of the leading retailer of consumer subject  credit applicatiions in grms this note is from ted murphy  not bjorn hagelman  my understanding is that yet another meeting ha been scheduled with the intent of diverting resource from the grms project to some other project  while i am not privy to the urgency of this other project  i do know that we have a very large  multi  phase project going in grms  grms stand for the global risk monitoring system  it is not intended to be a commercial trading product not is it primary purpose for commercial decision  making  conceptually  it is a risk warehouse for the primary purpose of rac due to the deficiency of current front office trading system and their inability to provide timely  aggregated information useful to rac  rac ha spent over a year developing a business plan scope and detailed task list to accomplish it objective  a a firm we are woefully behind our press clipping in our ability to aggregate and understand our risk profile  my most recent sojorn in europe is a classic example of the current system inabilty to aggregate and meet the need of rac having abetted poor decision making and causing cash loss in well in excess of the grms budget or that of the market risk group in rac  the grms project is a requirement that bill bradford and i have in order to do our job  we have delegated authority to debbie brackett and rudi zipter to make decision regarding priority and a such meet regularly with jonathon and his team a well a rick buy to provide update  while progress is never a fast a we would like it  in every instance in which we have only to rely on rac  jonathon  s team and research to make a deadline it haas been hit  the primary reason for any delay whatsoever ha been the diversion of resource off the project or the reliance for cooperation from some other source  most recently the it staff in london wa a tremendous impediment to deadline  please excuse the frustration that is apparently coming through in this note  but i feel like the boy with his finger in the dyke and no one is listening  also  i have had several employee come to resignation over their frustration on the lack of management support for this project  usually manifesting itself in the lack of resource or the diversion of resource devoted to it  i think we have proven collectively that we can organize a modular multiphase project and provide tangible deliverable when not distracted  please let u do our job  i do not denigrate the effort of others  but i believe that they must either submit their detailed requirement to u for our consideration of their worthiness to put in our que or develop their own project with their own resource  thank you for your consideration of this opinion  a it relates to thing that will effect the ability of market risk to do it job  please consult me a i would you  ted

subject  uk rpi model hi zimin  please find attached for your review the uk rpi model  derived by bootstrapping rpi swap  it  s a very simple model and here are it specific  swap structure payment  semi  semi act   f   yoyukrpi   ukrpi  p     ukrpi  p          p  payment month  the first payment is the latest known historical rpi  february        assumption  constant cashflows between the quoted year  a opposed to interpolating swap which distorts the curve a lot   this explains the atrocious look of the  raw  curve  it is then smoothed with a macro  which anjam wrote   mid point of the swap is used for deriving the curve   discount rate is libor and i solve for the coupon rate  which is the rpi yoy rate   the above is solved separately for each quoted period  e  g   yr   yr  and rpi rate are determined for the incremental portion  by forecasting rpi in the above method we are able to lock in and deliver the forecasted level  looking forward to your comment and seeing you in london  best regard  martina x

re  possible visit to enron by professor nalin kulatilaka of boston university hi iris i have two different hat to wear in talking to enron  one is a a financial economist  the other a the director of the newly formed  global mobility innovation initiative  gmii    this is the research project funded by lucent  involving bu  lb  and insead  to study various aspect of the mobile internet  read  g   on the former i am working with a couple of ph  d  student in understanding  a  detail of how having physical supply  inventory  can be used by a market maker  this is a problem that ha been study in the context of specialist inventory in the stock market but i think really interesting in the way enron doe it in some of the newer market like bandwidth  i think this is a big issue in lighting up all the dark fiber that is in the ground   b  how enron is disciplining the internal decision making process with market  this is in many way the critical aspect of real option that most finance people miss   having option is one thing but exercising them and realizing their value is another  all of the incomplete contracting  asymmetric information  and incentive issue are ignored in real option valuation model  but they are real in practice  my impression is enron  s real success is in putting place an organization that is able to mitigate these problem by imposing a market disciplining   c  how enron manages the various book that involve physicals  financials  credit etc  this is specially important when many of the real asset have option feature and therefore  include non  linear risk profile  the story of gas is pretty well understood but not many of the others market enron ha been moving into over the last few year  on the gmii front  i think that some interesting opportunity arise when you think of the spectrum in a way similar to that of dark fiber  i am working with several people at lucent on this issue  i think it would be wonderful to engage in a conversation with enron and lucent folk in the room  i can do a lunch time talk on any of these issue  perhaps we can discus some of these over a conference call  clearly  having vince kaminski in the room would be very important to me  a for schedule  the first  week of april are horrible  april     may    are good for me  regard nalin at    pm       mack  iris wrote   hi    a we briefly martin and i are working on various broadband related problem    we thought it might be helpful if you let u know a bit more about  the following    when you want to come  the research group ha weekly  catered lunch on thursday and brown bag lunch on every other friday      a description of what you want to talk about with respect  to telecom  broadband  etc    who you would like to meet with me  vince kaminski  our  bos   any other of our colleague in research  broadband  etc                    etc       look forward to hearing from you    regard   iris

factor underlying the exceptionally high volatility of electricity price  we feel that some of them may reflect the flaw in power pool design and incomplete transition to fully deregulated market in generation and transmission  the title is fine  vince shijie deng on           pm to  vkamins  enron  com cc  subject  re  informs abstract  fwd            forwarded message           date  sun   oct          edt  from  shijie deng to  vkaminski  aol  com cc  shijie deng subject  re  informs abstract vince  thanks for the abstract  for the purpose of the conference program listing  the conference organizer need a title and an abstract which is longer than  word  based on the abstract that you sent me  i took the liberty to make up a title and the   word abstract  attached below   please make change a you feel necessary and send them back to me  i  ll send them out to the organizer once i get your confirmation on this  best  shijie title  current challenge in modeling power price volatility author  dr  vince kaminski  head of quantitative research  enron capital  trade resource abstract  the power market development in the u have created several unique challenge for energy industry economist  we discus the major factor underlying the exceptionally high volatility of electricity price  we feel that some of them may be a necessary price to pay for increased market efficiency and expanded customer choice  shi  jie deng assistant professor school of isye georgia institute of technology office phone        e  mail  deng  isye  gatech  edu home page  http    www  isye  gatech  edu   deng on sun   oct  vkaminski  aol  com wrote   shijie    i am sending you the abstract for my informs presentation    vince            the last three year were characterized by exceptionally high volatility of  the power price in the u market  the market development have created a  number of unique challenge for energy industry economist  one immediate  question we have to answer is how to measure volatility of energy price   although we can all agree that the price in the power market are  characterized by high variability  the traditional measure used in financial  economics  annualized standard deviation of log price return  may not fit  well electricity price  the second challenge is to explain the source of  high price volatility and to answer the question to what extent it can be  attributed to problem that can be addressed in the long run  such problem  include flaw in market design that allow some market participant to abuse  market power  limited availability and  or unequal access to transmission   temporary shortage of generation capacity  some factor underlying high  volatility of electricity price may be of permanent nature and may be a  necessary price to pay for increased market efficiency and expanded customer  choice

subject  re  efa meeting hey vince  thanks for your reply  i  ll see what becomes of the session and keep you informed  a to the paper  tim crack and i have a revised version of the paper i gave you  we have since found out that by using certainty equivalence  our model is more robust  for example  if one ha an asset pricing model that incorporates mean  variance  and skewness  harvey and siddique  jf june    and a binomial model that incorporates mean  variance  and skewness  johnson  paulukiewicz  and mehta  rqfa     our model allows you to price option under the real world measure  the benefit is that one can take all of the model parameter from historical data that is non  risk neutralized  from a pricing perspective  there isn  t a tremendous benefit in a mean  variance world  variance stay the same in risk neutral or risky measure   however  in the mean  variance  skewness world  there is a benefit because we do not believe  although we  re still hunting down an appropriate cite  skewness is the same under risk  neutral and risky measure  given we can only measure the skewness in our risky world  our model becomes much more significant  i would certainly appreciate comment on the version of the paper you have and would also pas on the new version of the paper if you would like to see it  thanks again  tom

the honor to host a conference given by mr  vince kaminski head of research at enron corp    the  sixth event is  next friday  nov  rd    from         please attend    the next event in the student speaker series is  friday  november       a  m  to    p  m  fast lab  image  vince kaminski enron corp  tentative student speaker series schedule    the following is a tentative schedule of the mscf student speaker series for the    academic year  all event take place from    a  m  to    p  m  in the fast lab  gsia   unless otherwise noted  update are soon to follow  volatility curve and bond basis august    david hartney  jerry hanweck vice president  future and option sale j  p  morgan price and hedging volatility contract september    dmitry pugachevsky deutsche bank dmitry pugachesky is a director with otc derivative research of deutsche bank  where his research is primarily focussed on credit derivative  prior to joining deutsche bank  dmitry worked for six year with global analytics group of banker trust  there he developed model for emerging market  interest rate  and equity derivative and also participated in actual trading and structuring of interest rate option  he received his phd in applied mathematics from carnegie mellon university specializing in control theory for stochastic process  he ha published several paper on modelling in emerging market and on valuation for passport option  a measurement framework for bank liquidity risk september    raymond cote vice president  finrad inc  raymond cote is vice president  financial engineering at finrad inc   a montreal  based consulting firm offering financial management solution that combine advisory and system development service to  corporation and financial institution  abstract  liquidity risk  a opposed to credit and market risk  ha received little attention in professional or academic journal  we argue that analyzing bank liquidity risk can be viewed a a variation of credit risk analysis  after introducing some concept and definition  the presentation defines a framework allowing to measure a bank  s structural liquidity risk  it then show that combining the framework with modern credit risk measurement tool lead to a liquidity risk var measure  the presentation then offer concluding comment on the integration of the liquidity risk measurement framework within enterprise  wide risk management  the impact of electronic trading on the us of quantitative research in equity option september    scott morris hull group  quantitative research department quantitative research in investment management october    raman srivastava  anna bulkovshteyn assistant vice president   fixed income  quantitative analyst  putman investment  image  tba november    vince kaminski enron corp  fund management and market efficiency november    andrea dalton researcher  fries associate  advisor to the brandywine fund   tba november    jeff keifer  deb aep tutorial on bridge november    pierre subject  videoconferencing picture clear up network world fusion focus  neal weinberg on product review of the week today  s focus  videoconferencing picture clear up      dear wincenty kaminski                 this newsletter sponsored by w  quinn                   how to regain the   of nt   server space that  s wasted free  get a grip on spiraling disk consumption and regain   or more of your site   s enterprise storage capacity  wquinn  s storagecentral let you  monitor  track and control user disk consumption  identify and control what type of file your user can write to your server  get a grip on your nt   storage space   free eval  l copy and paste url that break in two line and remove extra space  today  s focus  videoconferencing picture clear up by neal weinberg if you   ve been turned off by the jumpy frame and poor audio quality associated with real  time videoconferencing  the reviewmeister ha good news for you  there   s a new generation of videoconferencing end  point device that provide business  quality picture and sound for under      we grabbed a box of popcorn and tested eight videoconferencing system  using  k bit  sec isdn and ip connection  in the category of videoconferencing appliance that is  standalone system that go in a conference room for group video session with colleague or business partner polycom   s viewstation mp wa the clear winner  the polycom viewstation provided outstanding video and audio quality  in addition  it wa easy to install  configure and use  in the category of pc  based product  which are especially good for virtual collaboration from your desktop  vcon   s mc  wa the hand  down winner  based on it high  quality component  the beauty of these product is they allow you to have a real  time video image of the person you   re conferencing with in one corner of the screen  with the rest of the space available for data collaboration  if you   re in the market for a system  be sure to get one with a sony evi d    video camera  an unidirectional boundary microphone  like the audio technica  and a quality sound mixer  and look for remote administration and system management tool  for example  the viewstation allows you to upgrade software  change setting  or change address book entry directly from the administrator   s system  most system will allow you to transmit over isdn or ip  but we found performance over ip wa dragged down by ip   s overhead requirement  for the complete product review  go to  of course  there   s more to videoconferencing than end point  so we whipped up an implementation guide that lay out the network topology  bandwidth and quality  of  service issue  based on our testing  the reviewmeister say now is the time to start pilot  testing a videoconferencing system  your chief information officer will love it when you tell him you can slash your company   s airline and hotel bill because you   ve got people from all over the company in virtual rather than face  to  face meeting  next week  we loaded window  on a pc and a server and ran gigabit ethernet to the desktop  guess where the bottleneck wa  to contact neal weinberg subject  organizational announcement enron global market ended the year with a great deal of momentum and with very high expectation for   in order to better focus and expand the various business within global market  we are pleased to announce the following organizational change  crude and product this group is being re  organized into product line in order to better focus and maximize coverage and increase our market  making ability  the following individual leading these group report directly to john nowlan  global crude oil don schroeder and bill white will manage our global crude oil book  don   s emphasis will be on the development and expansion of our physical crude position both domestically and abroad  bill will manage the various financial crude position globally and will focus on developing these book  distillate chris mahoney will have responsibility of all distillate position  chris will focus on developing our global distillate strategy  building the business both physically and financially  global fuel oil niamh clarke will expand her role managing our global fuel oil and resid position  emphasis will be placed on re  establishing enron in the financial fuel market in the u and developing a physical fuel strategy  global gasoline and component jim goughary will assume responsibility for our global gasoline and component business  following up on our expansion into the european market in   we look forward to jim expanding our presence in the u a well a asian market  global lpg erik hansen and adam gross will be responsible for the development and execution of our global lpg trading and strategy  under their guidance we look to expand our presence into the asian pacific market  a well a continuing to grow our u and european operation  petrochemical and plastic stuart bland and douglas friedman will be responsible for the continued development and growth of our petrochemical and plastic business  they will work to further expand both our physical and financial presence in these market  fuel management doug leach will continue in his role developing our fuel management business a well a other long  term structural transaction  global origination randy maffett ha joined the group to lead  develop and grow all global origination activity for the group  randy   s most recent assignment wa in restructuring several equity investment for ena  enron freight this new group under the leadership of dan reck is developing a business in the inter  modal transportation area in the united state  shawn cumberland ha joined this group to lead and expand the origination opportunity in this business  shawn   s most recent assignment wa a coo of the calme region  global risk management jere overdyke ha elected to leave enron after almost  year of service  per sekse will take over the leadership of this very exciting and growing business  per is located in enron   s new york office but will be spending a significant amount of his time in houston  we look forward to this year and feel the above change will provide the focus and momentum we need to deliver a record performance in   please congratulate everyone on their new assignment

subject  my model for spike dear dr  kaminski  i wa recently allowed to release into the public domain on the limited basis the first of the preprints that i recently authored on my model for spike in power price and for the valuation of the contingent claim on power  in this regard  i have just given a talk on this model at the joint seminar of the center for energy finance education and research and the institute for computational finance at the ut austin  right now i am also in the process of forming a list of specialist both in the industry and academia who might be interested in receiving this preprint  please let me know if you might be interested in receiving this preprint  i look forward to hearing from you  sincerely yours  valery kholodnyi manager of quantitative analysis research and analytics group txu energy trading p  here are the main preprints that i have recently authored on my model for spike in power price and valuation of contingent claim on power    valery a  kholodnyi  the stochastic process for power price with spike and valuation of european contingent claim on power  preprint  txu  rag      july     valery a  khlolodnyi  valuation of a swing option on power with spike  preprint txu  rag      august      valery a  kholodnyi  valuation of a spark spread option on power with spike  preprint txu  rag      november     valery a  kholodnyi  valuation of european contingent claim on power at two distinct point on the grid with spike in both power price  preprint txu  rag      november     valery a  kholodnyi  valuation of a transmission option on power with spike  preprint txu  rag      november   a i have indicated to you in my previous e  mail  contrary to the standard approach  i model spike directly  a self  reversing jump on top of a stochastic process for the regular dynamic of power price in the absence of spike  in this way the dynamic of power price is modeled a a non  markovian process  even if the process for the regular dynamic of power price is markovian  among other thing my model for spike allows for the explicit valuation and hedging of contingent claim on power with spike  provided that the corresponding contingent claim on power can be valued and hedged in the absence of spike

he plan to use the threat of an appeal  and a possible ballot initiative  to limit the amount of the rate hike  a plan to exempt the lowest income  smallest consumer from any rate increase and to concentrate rate increase among consumer using   of a baseline usage rate wa gaining serious momentum last night in sacramento  that would still hit about one half of all consumer  since the  baseline  is set at   of average consumption   but it is  progressive  in a politically important sense  making this work would require solving a minor crisis that erupted last night when pg  e admitted they had stopped reading electricity meter for many customer and were estimating their bill based on previous usage rate  the company  s defense  they had laid off meter reader to conserve cash  wa met with widespread derision a consumer advocate pointed out the estimation policy conveniently allowed the company to charge more despite serious effort by californian to use le electricity   every time you think there  s a moment when these utility will not embarrass themselves  something like this happens   one legislator moaned  long  term contract a second key to keeping the eventual rate increase down lie in the negotiation now almost complete for the first wave of long  term power buying contract davis initiated earlier this month  the first wave of those contract will be announced perhaps a early a today and they will be surprisingly positive  according to official in the talk   we got a series of good offer in those initial proposal  and some not so good one   one official told our source   the idea is to announce the result of the first contract talk with the good guy and then go back to the others and say   you want in on this with these term   we think we  ll eventually shake loose a lot of supply with this strategy   bankruptcy because of these new dynamic  there is improved market confidence that california will emerge from the current energy crisis without bankruptcy for socal edison and pg  e  even a they are set to miss another round of payment to creditor and supplier today  remember  there is a standstill agreement among creditor not to ask for accelerated payment until feb     we believe that sense of optimism will be given an even more credible boost by the court case in front of u district judge ronald s  w  lew in los angeles  which is likely to mushroom into the kind of political cover for elected official that make a settlement possible by the end of next week  at the latest  in fact  without that political cover it would be impossible to square all the various circle of this crisis  audit result and ballot initiative market  bush administration official  and perhaps utility company themselves are underweighting the possibility that citizen group will launch a successful ballot initiative in the fall of  l to bring all electricity generation back under state control  the threat of a proposition initiative mounted a the two audit of the utility company ordered by the california public utility commission released in the last  hour confirmed two seriously damaging point we have been warning about since mid  january  first  the audit of socal edison confirmed that   billion of the debt the utility claim it owes to energy supplier is actually owed to itself through it corporate holding structure that generates and sell power  second  it confirmed that edison electric paid nearly   billion in profit to the holding company which then used that money to buy back it stock and increase dividend in an effort to keep it stock price up even while it wa going on a debt  issuing binge  the audit of pg  e released late last night wa even more damaging  pg  e management wa sharply criticized for poor decision in failing to react to  clear warning sign of an approaching energy crisis  by not making deep spending cut   including scaling back management salary   the auditor also questioned the utility  s decision to funnel some     billion of it profit since deregulation into the coffer of it parent holding company  which then used the cash mostly to pay dividend and buy back stock   basically  they took the money and ran   a state senate speaker burton put it yesterday  what appears to be governor gray davis  grudging acceptance of reality is actually a highly evolved effort to produce a solution that provides enough rate hike  taxpayer subsidy to help solve the current crisis without triggering a new   and far more damaging   burst of populist outrage among a voter base that still think the utility company are basically making this all up  there is no doubt that this use of money by socal edison and the debt it owes to itself are perfectly legal and in keeping with the spirit of the  deregulation law  but that is irrelevant in popular political term  were it not for the political cover potentially afforded by the court case discussed below  these audit would make settlement extremely difficult  keeping that anger from exploding into a ballot initiative this fall is key to understanding the very complex game that davis  his adviser and senior legislator are now playing  a ballot initiative would be a potential disaster since it would almost certainly be aimed at re  establishing full public control over the electric utility  even if the state and utility successfully challenged such an initiative in court it would be year before that victory wa clear and it would freeze all new private investment during that prolonged period  that  s something california can not afford a business would be moving out and new one failing to relocate  court battle thus  legislator are listening in horror a they hear the ugly detail of the court case in los angeles that socal edison and pg  e are likely to win in mid  february  the court will most likely grant the two utility     billion in relief and that the cost would fall immediately on the shoulder of consumer who would see bill rise by at least    california politician could see the emergence of the one thing everyone ha needed since the start of this extended drama  political cover  davis will then have to rely on his political and negotiating skill to pressure the parent company of the utility to pas on something le than the full     billion debt  pg  e and socal edison have already won round one of a legal battle designed to let them raise electricity rate enough to recover all of the debt they have accumulated since august last year when the puc refused to let them raise price even a electricity price soared  the court said the  deregulation law wa crystal clear   when the two utility had repaid so  called  stranded cost   they were free to begin charging whatever they needed to charge consumer to cover their cost of acquiring power  although the utility won this case  the judge stayed his order until february  th at the state government  s request  a that deadline approach  an intense new negotiating round is under way  on the one hand  political official know they have the ultimate political cover for higher electric price   the court made me do it    but on the other hand  they also know that immediate and full compliance with that court order would force electricity rate up by about   on top of natural gas bill that have soared by about   since last year  utility company are playing this card aggressively in negotiation about the scope and shape of the final bailout   we  ll just wait until the court put the order into effect in mid  february then even if we are in bankruptcy we will emerge quickly and easily   one tactic the state political official are using  in order to force a settlement  is the threat of keeping the law suit tied up in court for the subject  california power      executive summary  sb   x give dept  of water and resource given legislative authority to undertake short  term power purchase with no price cap through feb   nd new legislation  ab   x and sb   x  would seek    long  term contract with    cent cap and    creation of california power and conservation financing authority the long  term contract proposed in ab   x are likely to be subject to significant amendment and renegotiation prior to the feb   nd expiration of sb   x  the authority proposed in sb   x would have bond issuance power to finance new generation capacity and conservation measure negotiation under way on using bond authority for a utility bailout   utility and state government split over debt obligation of utility parent state borrowing plan and power purchase create credit risk for state treasury  socal edison miss more payment bush administration opposes price cap  but is supporting state effort to split pg we believe he then could be willing to guarantee or issue bond to deal with the rest  a one very senior california political leader explained  getting the utility holding company to eat a substantial part of the debt they owe themselves is the key to solving the back debt problem without provoking widespread public outrage about a  bailout  of private price  gouging company with taxpayer money  since   of californian currently blame the utility and the puc for this crisis  and only   blame davis   this is a crucial political stance for the governor  but  of course  absorbing anything like   billion in debt would be quite a shock to the seemingly healthy holding company and power  generating branch of the two utility  and they began spreading the word that they were quite willing to accept bankruptcy  thus by mid  week  both side had pushed themselves toward a resolution in federal bankruptcy court that would be a worst case solution for all side  the country  s economy would suffer from the resulting credit shock  the governor  s political future would suffer from the electricity rate increase almost certain to be mandated by a bankruptcy judge  while most private sector legal authority believe the utility corporate holding structure would ultimately be breached during bankruptcy procedure and they would end up having to absorb some significant amount of the debt in the end  in addition  they would most likely face a state government determined to use state power of condemnation to enter the power business in a major way  senator burton  s sb  x legislation will strengthen those power dramatically to make this point quite explicit  it would set up a  california power and conservation financing authority   with the power to issue bond and invoke eminent domain  it would finance new power plant  and  consider the feasibility and public interest of the state acquiring  operating  and maintaining transmission facility currently owned by investor  owned and municipal utility   a we write this  all side are trying to construct a path back down from the bankruptcy ledge to safe ground  and there is no question the tone ha shifted in the last  hour from macho confrontation to  maybe we  ve run this thing out a far a we can   but a we have noted  the chance for miscalculation is still quite high  there is no solution agreed to at this time  the stand  off over how much debt the state government will absorb versus the utility  holding company is continuing  and the technical fact of default still make it possible for some bank to trigger bankruptcy by demanding immediate accelerated payment    default update  thursday socal edison    million default to california power exchange  after edison failed to make a   m electricity payment yesterday  the california power authority began seizing long  term contact and reselling them to recoup some of the money owed to generator  pg  e said it expects it trading privilege at the cal  power authority to be suspended today  leaving them with only it generation from nuclear and hydroelectric source  while the ongoing wave of default ha severely restricted pg  e  s and socal  s ability to buy power  the department of water and resource will be able to pick up some of the slack  at least in the very short  term  the state itself may be getting into risky credit territory  the proposed california public power authority would borrow in the neighborhood of     billion from the state general fund in advance of this year  s expected fiscal surplus  with the loan to be repaid by the authority from expected future revenue  with near  bankrupt utility and a freeze on rate hike  it is unclear where the revenue would come from  the amount borrowed and term of repayment will be no doubt examined very carefully by the bond rating agency    bush policy a we reported on wednesday  the bush administration continues to demonstrate little interest in getting involved in the california crisis  president  elect bush surprised state leader yesterday with his comment  which essentially said that excessive environmental regulation wa the root of the current supply shortage  bush and his top official appear to be unanimously opposed to long  term price cap  however  there is one issue of considerable importance to the administration  according to a source close to a top bush economic advisor  there is significant concern that pg  e  s credit problem could cause gas supplier to stop shipment of gas through pg  e  s pipeline  the risk would be that the pipeline could  go dry   causing significant and possibly dangerous disruption in california residence and business  to prevent this problem  bush is working with davis on a proposal to split pg  e into separate gas and electric company  the gas company would be solvent  but the electric company would go immediately into ch   following significant default

subject  short term private firm model  static historical snapshot  performance data for model development mike  scott  eric  after brainstorming and discussing further on data here  we think that our final specification for modelling data requirement need to be a follows  we need bankrupt  default and nondefault  which cover nonbankrupt  account with  quarterly observation snapshot and  month performance following the latest snapshot  monthly performance indicator need to be available for the entire  month performance period  we will need all the bankrupt and default account and comparable sample of good account with weight  for the purpose of model validation  we will need data with above spec covering  month of performance  this mean that we will need rolling   quarterly snapshot   month performance  data for  monthly shift  input snapshot performance  march end   june end   september end   december end  month end performance for jan  through dec   feb end   may end   august end   november end  month end performance for dec  through nov   jan end   apr end   july end   october end  month end performance for nov  through oct   december end   mar end   june end   september end  month end performance for oct  through sep  we will need bankruptcy chapterwise indicator  if available during the performance period  our definition of default is either bankruptcy or   day delinquency on any trade credit  we have also discussed the cost aspect and we think considering the big picture  it make sense to spend the extra amount to get the right data for analysis  please let me know your thought  this will require d  b to give u a modified quote and we could possibly move forward quickly  regard  amitava

subject  preface for book vince   hope you are well   we spoke a while ago about who should write the preface for the book  and you kindly offered that you would provide this   is this still possible   we realise that you are extremely busy  so chris and le went ahead and wrote something  which is below  and if you want to review  change or re  write  the preface  that would be very appreciated   let me know what your thought are   thanks  julie  we  re getting close    preface    one of our main objective in writing energy derivative  pricing and risk management ha been to bring together a many of the various approach for the pricing and risk management energy derivative a possible  to discus in  depth the model  and to show how they relate to each other   in this way we hope to help the reader to analyse the different model  price a wide range of energy derivative  or to build a risk management system which us a consistent modelling framework   we believe that for practitioner this last point is very important and we continue to stress in our article and presentation the danger of having flawed risk management and giving arbitrage opportunity to your competitor by using ad  hoc and inconsistent model for different instrument and market  see also others who propose consistent model     however  it is not our wish to concentrate on one particular model or model  at the exclusion of the others because we believe that the choice should rest with the user  although it will probably be clear from our discussion the model  s  we prefer    we therefore try and give a clear account a possible of the advantage and disadvantage of all the model so that the reader can make an informed choice a to the model which best suit their need   in order to meet our objective the book is divided into  chapter   in chapter  we give an overview of the fundamental principal needed to model and price energy derivative which will underpin the remainder of the book   in addition to introducing the technique that underlie the black  scholes modelling framework we outline the numerical technique of trinomial tree and monte carlo simulation for derivative pricing  which are used throughout the book   in chapter  we discus the analysis of spot energy price   a well a analysing empirical price movement we propose a number of process that can be used to model the price   we look at the well  know process of geometric brownian motion a well a mean reversion  stochastic volatility and jump process  discussing each and showing how they can be simulated and their parameter estimated   chapter   written by vince kaminski  grant masson and ronnie chahal of enron corp   discus volatility estimation in energy commodity market   this chapter build on the previous one   it examines in detail the method  merit and pitfall of the volatility estimation process assuming different pricing model introduced in chapter    example from crude  gas  and electricity market are used to illustrate the technical and interpretative aspect of calculating volatility   chapter  examines forward curve in the energy market   although such curve are well understood and straight  forward in the most financial market  the difficulty of storage in many energy market lead to le well defined curve   in this chapter we describe forward price bound for energy price and the building of forward curve from market instrument   we outline the three main approach which have been applied to building forward curve in energy market  the arbitrage approach  the econometric approach  and deriving analytical value by modelling underlying stochastic factor   chapter  present an overview of structure found in the energy derivative market and discus their us   example of product analysed in this chapter include a variety of swap  cap  floor and collar  a well a energy swaptions  compound option  asian option  barrier option  lookback option  and ladder option   chapter  investigates single and multi  factor model of the energy spot price and the pricing of some standard energy derivative   closed form solution for forward price  forward volatility  and european option price both on the spot and forward are derived and presented for all the model in this chapter including a three factor  stochastic convenience yield and interest rate model   chapter  show how the price of path dependent and american style option can be evaluated for the model in chapter    simulation scheme are developed for the evaluation of european style option and applied to a variety of path dependent option   in order to price option which incorporate early exercise opportunity  a trinomial tree scheme is developed   this tree is built to be consistent with the observed forward curve and can be used to price exotic a well a standard european and american style option   chapter  describes a methodology for valuing energy option based on modelling the whole of the market observed forward curve   the approach result in a multi  factor model that is able to realistically capture the evolution of a wide range of energy forward curve   the user defined volatility structure can be of an extremely general form   closed  form solution are developed for pricing standard european option  and efficient monte carlo scheme are presented for pricing exotic option   the chapter close with a discussion of the valuation of american style option   chapter  focus on the risk management of energy derivative position   in this chapter we discus the management of price risk for institution that trade option or other derivative and who are then faced with the problem of managing the risk through time   we begin with delta hedging a portfolio containing derivative and look at extension to gamma hedging   illustrating the technique using both spot and forward curve model   the general model presented in chapter  is ideally suited to multi  factor hedging of a portfolio of energy derivative and this is also discussed   chapter  examines the key risk management concept of value at risk  var  applied to portfolio containing energy derivative product   after discussing the concept of the measure  we look at how the key input  volatility  covariance  correlation  etc  can be estimated   we then compare the four major methodology for computing var  delta  delta  gamma  historical simulation and monte  carlo simulation  applying each to the same portfolio of energy option   in this chapter we also look at testing the var estimate for various underlying energy market variable   finally  in chapter  we review modelling approach to credit risk   we look in detail at two quite different approach  creditmetrics  j  p  morgan     and creditrisk   credit suisse financial product     for which detailed information is publicly available   together these provide an extensive set of tool with which to measure credit risk   we present numerical example of applying these technique to energy derivative   before we begin we stress that the model and method we present in this book are tool which should be used with the benefit of an understanding of how both the   tool   and the market work   the technique we describe are certainly not   magic wand   which can be waved at data and risk management problem to provide instant and perfect solution   to quote from the riskmetrics technical document     no amount of sophisticated analytics will replace experience and professional judgement in managing risk      however  the right tool  correctly used make the job a lot easier

option based on modelling the whole of the market observed  forward curve  the approach result  in a multi  factor model that is able to realistically capture the evolution of a wide range of energy forward curve   the user defined volatility structure can be of an extremely general  form  closed  form solution are  developed for pricing standard european option  and efficient monte carlo  scheme are presented for pricing exotic option  the chapter close with a discussion of the valuation of american style option  chapter  focus on the risk  management of energy derivative position   in this chapter we discus the management of price risk for institution  that trade option or other derivative and who are then faced with the problem  of managing the risk through time   we begin with delta hedging a portfolio containing derivative and look  at extension to gamma hedging  illustrating the technique using both spot and  forward curve model  the general  model presented in chapter  is ideally suited to multi  factor hedging of a  portfolio of energy derivative and this is also discussed  chapter  examines the key risk  management concept of value at risk  var  applied to portfolio containing  energy derivative product  after  discussing the concept of the measure  we look at how the key input   volatility  covariance  correlation  etc  can be estimated  we then compare the four major  methodology for computing var  delta  delta  gamma  historical simulation and  monte  carlo simulation  applying each to the same portfolio of energy  option  in this chapter we also  look at testing the var estimate for various underlying energy market  variable  finally  in chapter  we review  modelling approach to credit risk   we look in detail at two quite different approach  creditmetrics  j  p  morgan     and  creditrisk   credit suisse financial  product     for which detailed information is publicly available  together these provide an extensive set  of tool with which to measure credit risk  we present numerical example of applying these technique to energy derivative  before  we begin we stress that the model and method we present in this book are tool  which should be used with the benefit of an understanding of how both the  tool   and the market work  the  technique we describe are certainly not  magic wand  which can be waved at  data and risk management problem to provide instant and perfect solution  to quote from the riskmetrics technical document   no amount of sophisticated analytics will replace experience and professional judgement in managing risk     however  the right tool  correctly used make the job a lot  easier

subject  seasonal factor and curve fitting i have written a c   code to do the following  for a given curve  the code will filter out the seasonal factor  it then fit the deseasoned curve to a smooth function of the form f  t   a  a   t  b  c  with   which is useful in calculating forward  forward  vol   the output are season pattern   different pattern are allowed   and the smoothed curve  one can then calculate forward  forward vol  from the smoothed curve and superimpose the seasonal factor back  onto the curve    this procedure is not useful for var calcuation  however  i believe it  is useful for other situation which require the knowledge of seasonal  forward  forward vols  for example  in power plant valuation and  credit exposure simulation  it would reflect the reality more closely  if we add seasonality to our forward  forward vol in simulating the forward  price    attached are the spreadsheet and xll file  i will forward the c code if  any of you is interested    alex

subject  short term private firm model  static historical snapshot  performance data for model development mike  scott  eric  after brainstorming and discussing further on data here  we think that our final specification for modelling data requirement need to be a follows  we need bankrupt  default and nondefault  which cover nonbankrupt  account with  quarterly observation snapshot and  month performance following the latest snapshot  monthly performance indicator need to be available for the entire  month performance period  we will need all the bankrupt and default account and comparable sample of good account with weight  for the purpose of model validation  we will need data with above spec covering  month of performance  this mean that we will need rolling   quarterly snapshot   month performance  data for  monthly shift  input snapshot performance  march end   june end   september end   december end  month end performance for jan  through dec   feb end   may end   august end   november end  month end performance for dec  through nov   jan end   apr end   july end   october end  month end performance for nov  through oct   december end   mar end   june end   september end  month end performance for oct  through sep  we will need bankruptcy chapterwise indicator  if available during the performance period  our definition of default is either bankruptcy or   day delinquency on any trade credit  we have also discussed the cost aspect and we think considering the big picture  it make sense to spend the extra amount to get the right data for analysis  please let me know your thought  this will require d  b to give u a modified quote and we could possibly move forward quickly  regard  amitava

subject  a colossal and dangerous failure  cera alert title  a colossal and dangerous failure url  http    www   cera  com  eprofile  u    m   overview  western energy   california governor stay the course california governor gray davis provided his strongest public statement to date regarding the state   s power crisis in his annual state of the state address on january     echoing many of his previous position on what he perceives a a flawed and unfair california market structure  the governor labeled the state   s electricity market system a colossal and dangerous failure  among other action  he launched new initiative valued at   billion to encourage conservation  provide financing and land to new generator  grant authority to utility to engage in a portfolio of transaction to manage electricity cost  and increase regulatory scrutiny of existing market supplier  the governor also called for a greater role for the state in overseeing and constructing new power plant  the governor acknowledged that the action proposed are only some of the step necessary to put california on the road to recovery  detail regarding source of funding for the initiative are still forthcoming  although he stated that california   s investor  owned utility must not be allowed to go bankrupt  no formal plan for ensuring their solvency wa given  the financial community continues to lack the assurance it requires to continue to provide financial backing for pacific gas and electric and southern california edison  at this time the state legislature remains the body most likely to guarantee their solvency  the governor again criticized the federal energy regulatory commission for what he belief ha been it failure to manage and restrain properly the wholesale market  merchant plant generator were accused of gouging the state  and it wa suggested that these generator acted illegally in their operation  jeopardizing the reliability of the power grid  new  more severe sanction were promised for those caught withholding power or extracting what investigator find a unreasonable profit  a los angeles time poll released the morning before the governor   s address indicated that the majority of californian still do not believe there is an energy crisis  although the  percent growth in the state   s economy over the past ten year ha nearly outstripped the state   s and surrounding region   s supply of power  the bulk of the governor   s statement continue to focus on the culpability of power producer  rather than the serious supply shortfall  though the governor introduced step to fund and facilitate the construction of new generating plant  increased regulatory scrutiny and the threat of sanction will exacerbate the concern already expressed by plant developer and the financial community that the investment climate in california is excessively risky    end   follow above url for complete report  come shoot the rapid with u at ceraweek    shooting the rapid  strategy and risk for the energy future  in houston  february       for more information and to register  please visit http    www   cera  com  ceraweek  e  mail category  alert cera knowledge area  s   western energy  to make change to your cera  com account go to  forgot your username and password  go to  http    www   cera  com  client  forgot this electronic message and attachment  if any  contain information from cambridge energy research associate  inc   cera  which is confidential and may be privileged  unauthorized disclosure  copying  distribution or use of the content of this message or any attachment  in whole or in part  is strictly prohibited  term of use  http    www   cera  com  tos question  comment  webmaster  cera  com copyright   cambridge energy
